conclusion: Trying to solve problem about charged particle in magnetic fields.
Description of two magnetic fields B1 and B2, particle with charge q and mass m entering B1 perpendicularly at point O.
Relationship between magnetic fields is B1 = 2B2.
Need to find time for particle to pass through point O downward again.
Particles in magnetic fields move in circular paths due to Lorentz force.
Lorentz force is perpendicular to velocity and magnetic field, causing circular motion.
Lorentz force formula: F = qvB sinθ.
Variables in Lorentz force formula: q (charge), v (velocity), B (magnetic field), θ (angle between v and B).
Since particle enters perpendicularly, θ = 90 degrees, sinθ = 1, so F = qvB.
Lorentz force provides centripetal acceleration: qvB = mv²/r.
Solving for radius: r = mv / qB.
Particle enters B1 first, with B1 = 2B2.
Diagram shows horizontal line MN, vertical lines B1 and B2, particle enters at point O on MN.
If MN is horizontal and particle enters perpendicularly, it moves vertically.
Particle enters B1 vertically upwards, curves in a circle due to magnetic force.
When reaching interface, particle enters B2 where magnetic field is halved.
Particle's radius of curvature changes in B2.
Need to find time for particle to return to point O moving downward.
Using right-hand rule, if B1 is into the page and v is upwards, force is to the left.
Particle moves in a circle in B1, curving to the left.
In B2, with B out of the page and v upwards, force is to the right.
In B2, particle curves to the right.
